item.title: The probability of a Fed rate cut in September is 87.3%.
item.description: On August 25th, based on CME's "FedWatch": The likelihood that the Fed will maintain interest rates unchanged in September is 12.7%, and the probability of a 25-basis-point rate cut is 87.3%.The probability of the Fed keeping interest rates unchanged in October is 6.4%. The cumulative probability of a 25-basis-point rate cut is 50.6%, and the cumulative probability of a 50-basis-point rate cut is 42.9%.

item.title: Willy Woo: Bitcoin's slow uptrend this cycle is due to ancient whale selling pressure, and the market needs to absorb chips with a thousandfold return.
item.description: On August 25th, the cryptocurrency analyst Willy Woo tweeted, "Why is the price appreciation of Bitcoin so slow during this cycle? Bitcoin's supply is highly inclined towards ancient whales who reached their peak in holdings around 2011. They mainly bought Bitcoin at $10 or lower. Currently, for every BTC they sell, the market requires more than $110,000 in new capital to absorb it.""This cost basis delta, their supply in hand, and the speed at which they are selling have significant implications for the amount of new capital needed to drive the price up. This can be regarded as growing pains for Bitcoin until these early 10,000X gainers are completely absorbed by the market."

item.title: In the past 24 hours, the entire network has seen $628 million in liquidations, with over 130,000 people being liquidated.
item.description: On August 25th, based on Coinglass data, the total liquidation across the entire network within the past 24 hours was $628 million. The long liquidations totaled $459 million, and the short liquidations totaled $168 million.A total of 139,847 individuals were liquidated. The largest single liquidation took place on OKX - BTC-USDT-SWAP, amounting to $12.4876 million.

item.title: Two Bitcoin Ancient Whales Have Sold Over 18,000 BTC Combined, Now Holding Over 550,000 ETH in Exposure
item.description: On August 25th, according to the monitoring of mlm, two Bitcoin ancient whales (possibly the same entity) have sold 18,142 BTC, which is valued at $2.04 billion at the current price.The entity is selling the remaining 5,968 BTC (worth $670 million), and 4,968 BTC (worth $678 million) is still outside of Hyperliquid. So far, the entity has purchased a total of 416,598 ETH (currently valued at $1.98 billion), and it is long 135,263 ETH (worth $642 million) on perpetual contracts. The total ETH exposure is 551,861 ETH, valued at $2.62 billion.Among the 416,598 ETH (valued at $1.98 billion), 275,500 ETH (worth $1.3 billion) has been staked.

item.title: In the past 1 hour, the entire network has seen $299 million in liquidations, with short positions accounting for $18.09 million in liquidations.
item.description: On August 25th, according to Coinglass data, within the past 1 hour, the total value of liquidations across the entire network amounted to $299 million. There were $280 million in long liquidations and $18.0926 million in short liquidations. Bitcoin witnessed $202 million in liquidations, while Ethereum saw $45.4531 million in liquidations.

item.title: Bitcoin Experiences Short-Term Dip Below $112,000 With a "Needle Pin" Pattern
item.description: On August 25th, based on HTX market data, Bitcoin briefly fell below $112,000 and plunged to a low of $110,680 before rebounding to $112,670, with a 24-hour decline of 2.06%.

item.title: Ethereum Temporarily Drops Below $4750
item.description: On August 25th, based on HTX market data, Ethereum briefly fell below $4,750 and is now recovering to $4,804. The 24-hour gain has narrowed to 1.26%.

item.title: Ethereum Breaks $4900, Hits New All-Time High
item.description: On August 25th, based on HTX market data, Ethereum surpassed $4900 and reached a new all-time high with a 24-hour percentage change of 3.27%.

item.title: A Two-Bitcoin Ancient Whale Stakes 275,500 ETH, Worth $1.3 Billion
item.description: On August 25th, based on on-chain data, a two-bitcoin ancient whale has staked all the ETH it obtained from selling BTC in the past four days to increase its holdings. The total stake is 275,500 ETH, which is worth $1.3 billion.

item.title: Galaxy Digital Founder Reveals Holding HYPE Long Position
item.description: On August 25th, Mike Novogratz, the founder and CEO of Galaxy Digital, responded to Ryan Watkins, the co-founder of Syncracy Capital. Watkins tweeted about "the BTC spot trading volume of the Hyperliquid platform in the past 24 hours exceeding the sum of Coinbase and Bybit." Novogratz said, "Impressive work. For full disclosure, we hold a long position in the HYPE token."
